intro: Hieracium ochranthum, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it thrives in grassy habitats and open areas. The plant is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium ochranthum is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of nutrient-rich environments.
